intro.description: The SOLVER framework helps you systematically approach problems that can be changed. Work through each step to find effective solutions.

sections.title: State the Problem Clearly
sections.description: Identify and describe the problem in a clear, specific, and concise way. Avoid vague or overly emotional descriptions.
sections.question: What is the specific problem you're facing?
sections.example: Instead of 'Everything is a mess,' try 'I feel overwhelmed because I have three deadlines this week.'

sections.title: Observe Your Options
sections.description: Brainstorm all possible solutions without judgment. Consider various approaches, even unconventional ones.

sections.title: List the Pros and Cons
sections.description: Evaluate the benefits and drawbacks of each potential solution. Think about short-term and long-term consequences.

sections.title: Verify the Best Solution
sections.description: Choose the most effective solution based on your values, goals, and the analysis of pros and cons.
questions: Why is this the best choice for you?
placeholders: e.g., I will prioritize two deadlines while requesting an extension for the third
Consider your values, goals, and what matters most to you in this situation...

sections.title: Execute Your Solution
sections.description: Plan how to implement your solution with specific, actionable steps.
questions: How will you implement this solution?
What specific steps will you take?
placeholders: Break down the specific steps you'll take to put this solution into action...
Consider your values, goals, and what matters most to you in this situation...

sections.title: Reflection & Evaluation
sections.description: After trying your solution, reflect on how well it worked and what you learned.
sections.question: How did it work? What was the outcome?
sections.placeholder: Did this reduce your stress? Meet your goals? How did it feel to implement?
